GClasses::GSupervisedLearner

GClasses::GSupervisedLearner Class Reference

This is the base class of algorithms that learn with supervision and have an internal hypothesis model that allows them to generalize rows that were not available at training time. More...

#include <GLearner.h>

Inheritance diagram for GClasses::GSupervisedLearner:

List of all members.

Public Member Functions

 GSupervisedLearner ()
 GSupervisedLearner (GTwtNode *pLearner)
virtual ~GSupervisedLearner ()
virtual GTwtNode * toTwt (GTwtDoc *pDoc)=0
 Save to a text-based format. Implementations of this method should use MakeBaseTwtNode.
virtual bool canGeneralize ()
 Returns true because fully supervised learners have an internal model that allows them to generalize previously unseen rows.
virtual int featureDims ()=0
 Returns the number of feature dims. Throws an exception if the model has not yet been trained. (In the case of incremental learners, it should work if enableIncrementalLearning has been called.).
virtual int labelDims ()=0
 Returns the number of label dims. Throws an exception if the model has not yet been trained. (In the case of incremental learners, it should work if enableIncrementalLearning has been called.).
virtual void train (GData *pData, int labelDims)=0
 Trains the model with pData. (Any previous training will be discarded.) The last "labelDims" columns in the data represent the label. All of the preceding columns are the feature vectors.
virtual void predictDistribution (const double *pIn, GPrediction *pOut)=0
 Evaluate pIn and compute a prediction for pOut. pOut is expected to point to an array of GPrediction objects which have already been allocated. There should be labelDims() elements in this array. Even though the prediction is a probability distribution, this distribution is not calibrated. For continuous label dimensions, the mean should be a good prediction, but the variance may be a very rough estimate, or even a bogus value, depending on the algorithm. For discrete label dimensions, the mode is the most-likely prediction, but the confidence values of other categories may be determined by weak heuristics, depending on the algorithm.
virtual void predict (const double *pIn, double *pOut)=0
 Evaluate pIn and compute a prediction for pOut.
virtual void clear ()=0
 Discards all training for the purpose of freeing memory. If you call this method, you must train before making any predictions. No settings or options are discarded.
void accuracy (GData *pData, double *pOutResults)
 Computes predictive accuracy for nominal label dimensions, and the mean squared error for continuous outputs. pOutResults should have m_labelDims dimensions.
void precisionRecall (double *pOutPrecision, int nPrecisionSize, GData *pData, int labelDims, int label, int nReps, GRand *pRand)
 label specifies which output to measure. (It should be 0 if there is only one label dimension.) The measurement will be performed "nReps" times and results averaged together nPrecisionSize specifies the number of points at which the function is sampled pOutPrecision should be an array big enough to hold nPrecisionSize elements for every possible label value. (If the attribute is continuous, it should just be big enough to hold nPrecisionSize elements.) If bLocal is true, it computes the local precision instead of the global precision.
virtual void transduce (GData *pDataLabeled, GData *pDataUnlabeled, int labelDims)
 See GSemiSupervisedLearner::transduce.
virtual void trainAndTest (GData *pTrainingSet, GData *pTestSet, int labelDims, double *pOutResults)
 Trains and tests this learner.
void basicTest (double minAccuracy, GRand *pRand, double deviation=1e-6)
 This is a helper method used by the unit tests of several model learners.

int precisionRecallNominal (GPrediction *pOutput, double *pFunc, GData *pTrain, GData *pTest, int labelDims, int label, int value)
 This is a helper method used by precisionRecall.
int precisionRecallContinuous (GPrediction *pOutput, double *pFunc, GData *pTrain, GData *pTest, int labelDims, int label)
 This is a helper method used by precisionRecall.

Detailed Description

This is the base class of algorithms that learn with supervision and have an internal hypothesis model that allows them to generalize rows that were not available at training time.

Returns true because fully supervised learners have an internal model that allows them to generalize previously unseen rows.

virtual void GClasses::GSupervisedLearner::clear (  )  [pure virtual]

Discards all training for the purpose of freeing memory. If you call this method, you must train before making any predictions. No settings or options are discarded.

void GClasses::GSupervisedLearner::precisionRecall ( double *  pOutPrecision,
int  nPrecisionSize,
GData *  pData,
int  labelDims,
int  label,
int  nReps,
GRand *  pRand 
)

label specifies which output to measure. (It should be 0 if there is only one label dimension.) The measurement will be performed "nReps" times and results averaged together nPrecisionSize specifies the number of points at which the function is sampled pOutPrecision should be an array big enough to hold nPrecisionSize elements for every possible label value. (If the attribute is continuous, it should just be big enough to hold nPrecisionSize elements.) If bLocal is true, it computes the local precision instead of the global precision.

Implemented in GClasses::GDecisionTree, GClasses::GMeanMarginsTree, GClasses::GBag, GClasses::GBucket, GClasses::GKernelMachine, GClasses::GKNN, GClasses::GInstanceTable, GClasses::GBaselineLearner, GClasses::GIdentityFunction, GClasses::GLinearRegressor, GClasses::GNaiveBayes, GClasses::GNaiveMLE, GClasses::GNaiveInstance, GClasses::GNeuralNet, GClasses::GPolynomial, and GClasses::GFilter.

virtual void GClasses::GSupervisedLearner::predictDistribution ( const double *  pIn,
GPrediction *  pOut 
) [pure virtual]

Evaluate pIn and compute a prediction for pOut. pOut is expected to point to an array of GPrediction objects which have already been allocated. There should be labelDims() elements in this array. Even though the prediction is a probability distribution, this distribution is not calibrated. For continuous label dimensions, the mean should be a good prediction, but the variance may be a very rough estimate, or even a bogus value, depending on the algorithm. For discrete label dimensions, the mode is the most-likely prediction, but the confidence values of other categories may be determined by weak heuristics, depending on the algorithm.

Implemented in GClasses::GDecisionTree, GClasses::GMeanMarginsTree, GClasses::GBag, GClasses::GBucket, GClasses::GKernelMachine, GClasses::GKNN, GClasses::GInstanceTable, GClasses::GBaselineLearner, GClasses::GIdentityFunction, GClasses::GLinearRegressor, GClasses::GNaiveBayes, GClasses::GNaiveMLE, GClasses::GNaiveInstance, GClasses::GNeuralNet, GClasses::GPolynomial, and GClasses::GFilter.

virtual GTwtNode* GClasses::GSupervisedLearner::toTwt ( GTwtDoc *  pDoc  )  [pure virtual]

Save to a text-based format. Implementations of this method should use MakeBaseTwtNode.

Implemented in GClasses::GDecisionTree, GClasses::GMeanMarginsTree, GClasses::GBag, GClasses::GBucket, GClasses::GKernelMachine, GClasses::GKNN, GClasses::GInstanceTable, GClasses::GBaselineLearner, GClasses::GIdentityFunction, GClasses::GLinearRegressor, GClasses::GNaiveBayes, GClasses::GNaiveMLE, GClasses::GNaiveInstance, GClasses::GNeuralNet, GClasses::GPolynomial, and GClasses::GFilter.

virtual void GClasses::GSupervisedLearner::train ( GData *  pData,
int  labelDims 
) [pure virtual]

Trains the model with pData. (Any previous training will be discarded.) The last "labelDims" columns in the data represent the label. All of the preceding columns are the feature vectors.
